attributes.comment:
My husband and I are in the process of adopting a child from Colombia, South
America. Due to the lengthy process, our original I-600A expired and we had to
re-apply for this document. Most countries require proof that the document has
been accepted before they will even accept you into their program; since it is
only good for 18 months, it is likely that a lot of people would have to pay for
this twice. This is one of the most expensive single documents you must
complete when adopting, and raising the rate will only put more hardship on
adoptive parents. If the rate is raised, I think the length of time the document
is good for should also be extended greatly, and anyone having to re-do the
document due to expiration while waiting for their adoption to go through should
receive a discounted rate.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Erika Albin
